div3.head: PROPOSITION 23.

p.hi: If two number be prime to one another, the number which measures the one of them will be prime to the remaining number.

div3.p: Let A, B be two numbers prime to one another, and let any number C measure A; I say that C, B are also prime to one another.
For, if C, B are not prime to one another, some number will measure C, B.
Let a number measure them, and let it be D.
Since D measures C, and C measures A, therefore D also measures A.
But it also measures B; D measures A, B which are prime to one another: which is impossible. [VII. Def. 12]
Therefore no number will measure the numbers C, B.
Therefore C, B are prime to one another. Q. E. D.
